title: Louis Latour 2014  Côte de Nuits-Villages
description: From vineyards at the south end of the Côte de Nuits, this is a fruity, crisp wine with attractive ready-to-drink fruit flavors. The aftertaste is tight and packed with acidity.

title: Louis Latour 2014  Marsannay
description: With some tannins and with bright red fruits, this wine is structured and has attractive acidity. A perfumed wine with a fruity future, it will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Kitá 2013 Camp 4 Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Minty, camphor-like aromas arise off of this bottling, alongside milk chocolate, tart berries and raw beef aromas. The mouthfeel is comparatively thin, showing peppery cherry juice, dried dill and other herbal flavors.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Hautes Côtes de Nuits
description: Vines planted between 900 and 1,200 feet above sea level give this cool interpretation of Pinot Noir. The wine is crisp, lightly structured with some tannins and with a delicate cherry and red-berry fruitiness. It will be ready to drink from 2017.

title: Jean-Marie Chaland 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)
description: Aromatic with ripe yellow fruits, this wine conveys flavors of mango and apricot. Rich and creamy, it has just enough acidity to give a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Julietta 2015 Romeo's Rosé (California)
description: A pinkish copper color, light cherry and raspberry flavors and a smooth, rounded mouth-feel make this full-bodied wine easy to sip and enjoy.

title: Jacob's Creek 2015 Two Lands Pinot Grigio (Australia)
description: Loaded with ripe pear, muskmelon and tropical fruit, this is a medium-bodied, plump white with crowd appeal. It seems a bit off dry, but closes on a citrusy note.

title: Gotsa Family Wines 2014 Asureti Valley Chinuri (Kartli)
description: Amber in color, this wine has aromas of peach jam and orange blossom. Flavors are a mélange of mellow fruit and savory notes, in particular apricot, lemon curd, quince and bitter almond. Despite strong tannins, there are moments of brightness across the entire palate that linger into the finish.

title: Graffigna 2012 Grand Reserve Malbec (San Juan)
description: Smashed berry aromas are backed by earth and toasty oak notes. Fairly hard and tannic on the palate, this shows herbal plum flavors in front of a bold finish with dry tannins and a hint of wood spice.

title: Four Sisters 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Victoria)
description: Pungent boxwood notes unfold on the nose, while the palate offers hints of tomato and tobacco leaves alongside white grapefruit. This medium-bodied wine finishes bright, marked by fresh greens.

title: Fiuza 2015 Touriga Nacional-Alicante Bouschet Red (Tejo)
description: There is a rustic side to this wine, not unattractive and given a lift by the juicy acidity and spice aftertaste. The wine is dark in color, more fruit than structure. It is ready to drink.

title: Piazzo Armando 2013  Barbaresco
description: Toast, hazelnut, plum, underbrush and leather aromas emerge in the glass. The palate is muddled, offering tart sour cherry, bitter dark chocolate, orange zest and clove alongside somewhat raw, rather grainy tannins.

title: Frédéric Brouca 2013 Samsó Seulle Cinsault (Vin de France)
description: Juicy dark plum, cherry and boysenberry are upfront on the nose, with additional seductive hints of purple violet and vanilla. The palate is plush and fruit-forward, with ample acidity and medium tannins that lend pleasant structure. Accents of sweet spice grace the finish.

title: Fullerton 2015 Three Otters Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: This light, refreshing rosé mixes fresh strawberry fruit with apple-flavored acids. It's finished bone dry, with an almost dusty mouthfeel (in a good kind of way).

title: Leonard Kreusch 2015 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Veins of smoke and wax seep through fresh apple, lemon and lime in this refreshingly spry Riesling. Medium-sweet in style, it balances crisp citrus flavors against a savory, earthier side of brambles and dried herb. The finish lingers moderately long.

title: Lincourt 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There is a bright but not overdone tropicality to this fresh and inviting wine, which shows lily, Gala apple and pear flesh on the nose and tightens up on gravel and citrus peel. The flavors are broad and easy, with a slight Granny Smith apple sharpness.

title: Mendoza Vineyards 2013 1907 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Stalky, lightly herbal aromas of red fruits and tomato filter onto a full but bland and chunky palate. Stalky, salty flavors of plum and currant lack full ripeness, while this finishes solid but stewy in flavor.

title: Pelissero 2013 Vanotu  (Barbaresco)
description: Toast, espresso, dried porcini and roasted coffee bean aromas take shape in the glass. The dense but rather evolved palate shows dried black cherry, espresso, oak, coconut and a green note of powdered sage but not a lot of fruit richness. Close-grained tannins leave a firm, astringent finish. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Twisted River 2015 Bin 168 Riesling (Mosel)
description: While the nose reveals only faint whiffs of apples, nuts and brambles, the palate of this off-dry Riesling is crisply concentrated with fresh red apples and tart peaches. It's not a deeply persistent wine, but finishes brisk and bright.

title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port)
description: This is a ripe wine with spice, wood-aging flavors and plenty of fruit for balance. It is soft, sweet with a toffee and caramel richness. The wine is spicy with wood flavors that are too strong at the end.

title: Silver Palm 2014 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Butterscotch aromas, buttery, nutty flavors and full body make a pretty big impact as this dry and full-bodied wine pulls them all together.

title: Spicewood 2014 Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)
description: Herbal forward, with dill, basil and strawberry leading the nose. Mildly concentrated on the light-bodied palate, additional herb notes in the way of dill and thyme appear and linger on the finish.

title: Vila Nova 2015 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)
description: A bright, lemon flavored wine with tight acidity and an attractive mineral texture. It is floral, zesty and very ready to drink.

title: Ribafreixo 2015 Gáudio Verdelho (Alentejano)
description: The attractive perfumed Verdelho gives a light, bright and fresh wine. It is crisply textured with lively acidity and a tangy texture. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Ricardo Santos 2014 La Madras Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Strong aromas of mint and licorice root share space on the nose with herbal, foxy cassis and raspberry scents. A grabby, scratchy mouthfeel and flavors of black fruits infused with an herbal component finish with notes of rosemary, licorice and peppery spice as well as a grating feel.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2014 Orange Label Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from grapes grown on the Olivet Lane Vineyard, this wine features a ripe softness marked in sandalwood, cherry and earthy strawberry, the body and acidity levels moderate.

title: Virna Borgogno 2012  Barolo
description: This opens with aromas that recall nail polish remover, dark spice and toast. The palate offers fleshy black cherry, vanilla and a hint of coffee alongside bracing tannins. It finishes on an astringent note.

title: Teliani Valley 2013 Tsinandali White (Kakheti)
description: Light straw in color, this wine has a soft nose of apricot and clementine. It offers refreshing flavors of honeydew melon, peach and lemon, and it is bright from the first sip through the tangerine and lemon curd finish.

title: Salentein 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Uco Valley)
description: Honest Pinot Noir aromas of spicy, leafy cherry and plum are good but common. This feels just about right, albeit a touch full and creamy. Flavors of cola, cherry and chocolate are ripe, moderately oaked and finish creamy, with flavors of vanilla, savory spices and rooty sweetness.

title: Schuchmann Wines 2014 Mtsvane (Kakheti)
description: Aromas of orange blossom and lemon pith prime the palate for flavors of pink grapefruit, orange zest, lemon curd and white flowers. This wine is refreshing from start to finish.
